meanings.definition: A star that suddenly increases greatly in brightness because of a catastrophic explosion that ejects most of its mass.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study supernovas to understand how stars change dramatically in brightness.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers use powerful telescopes to observe supernovas in distant galaxies.
meanings.sent3: When the supernovas put on a dazzling light show, the whole universe takes notice.
meanings.sent4: The supernovas in the sky are like fireworks celebrating the end of a star's life.
meanings.sent5: The explosion of supernovas is so intense that it can be seen from light-years away.

meanings.definition: The explosion of a star that increases its brightness to typically a billion times that of the sun.
meanings.sent1: Supernovas release an incredible amount of energy during their explosive outbursts.
meanings.sent2: The night sky can be illuminated by the brilliance of supernovas shining brightly.
meanings.sent3: Imagine if supernovas were like cosmic light bulbs that flicker on and off.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of supernovas lies in their ability to transform into radiant beacons in space.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the glow of supernovas is a breathtaking experience for stargazers.
